title: Kate Ritchie 'has retreated into her own world' amid AVO drama with husband
text:
Former Home and Away star Kate Ritchie is reportedly feeling 'isolated' after police took out a temporary AVO against her husband, Stuart Webb, earlier this month.

According to New Idea magazine, friends of the actress and radio personality claim she has 'retreated into her own world' as her personal life makes headlines.

'We've all been worried about Kate,' said an anonymous source.

Under strain? Former Home and Away star Kate Ritchie is reportedly feeling 'isolated' after police took out a temporary AVO against her husband, Stuart Webb, earlier this month. Pictured at Sydney Airport on Sunday, October 20

The insider, who is described as a 'former colleague' of Kate's, added that her marriage to Stuart, 39, never quite matched the 'fairytale' in her head.

'Kate has tried to make it work,' they said. 'I know in the past she's confided a lot in [Home and Away stars] Emily Symons and Lynne McGranger, but this time she's retreated into her own world.

'I know she'd be horrified to have her personal life exposed like this.'

Ordeal: According to New Idea, friends of the actress and radio personality, 41, claim she has 'retreated into her own world' as her personal life makes headlines. Pictured with Stuart

Earlier this month, NSW Police took out an interim apprehended violence order (AVO) on behalf of Kate, 41, against her husband, Stuart.

The decision to grant the temporary AVO came after 'an incident at a home in Randwick on Thursday [October 17],' according to a police spokesperson.

They added that the investigation was ongoing, but no charges had been laid.

On Thursday, October 24, the temporary AVO was extended for at least two more weeks while the case was adjourned.

Going to ground: 'I know in the past [Kate] has confided a lot in Emily Symons and Lynne McGranger (pictured), but this time she's retreated into her own world,' claimed a source

The court order states that Stuart, a former NRL player, cannot be near his wife 'for at least 12 hours after drinking alcohol or taking illicit drugs'.

The order continues: 'The defendant must not do any of the following to Katherine Leigh RITCHIE, or anyone else she has a domestic relationship with: A. assault or threaten her, B. stalk, harass or intimidate her, and C. intentionally or recklessly destroy or damage any property that belongs to or is in the possession of Katherine Leigh RITCHIE.'

The couple's relationship had reportedly been under 'stress' before the incident in Randwick after Stuart pleaded guilty to a drink driving charge earlier this year.

Incident: Earlier this month, NSW Police took out an interim apprehended violence order (AVO) on behalf of Kate against her husband, Stuart. Pictured at the Logie Awards on April 27, 2014 in Melbourne

Stuart, who had previously been found guilty of drink driving in 2012 and 2017, blew 0.083 after police spotted him running a red light on March 26.

He is awaiting sentencing for the latest drink driving charge. The AVO case continues.

Kate and Stuart, who share five-year-old daughter Mae, married in 2010.
description: Former Home and Away star Kate Ritchie is reportedly feeling 'isolated' after police took out a temporary AVO against her husband, Stuart Webb, earlier this month.
authors: Jo Scrimshire For Daily Mail Australia
